summary: The diff does not implement the requested production rollback (REQ-19). Instead, it only modifies `project_state.json`, which is unrelated to performing a deployment rollback and also violates the “no code changes introduced” acceptance criterion.

missing_requirements.requirement: Roll back the live production site from Version 6 to the previously deployed Version 5 (production rollback only; do not change the draft/codebase).
missing_requirements.reason: No deployment/rollback procedure changes or deployment-target changes are shown in the diff. The only modified file is `project_state.json`, which does not demonstrate switching production from v6 to v5 or following `frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md`.

missing_requirements.requirement: Public production URL serves the Version 5 build (not Version 6).
missing_requirements.reason: There is no evidence in the diff of any production deployment configuration or rollback action that would change what the public production URL serves.

missing_requirements.requirement: No code changes are introduced as part of the rollback; only the production deployment target changes.
missing_requirements.reason: A repository file (`project_state.json`) was modified, which is a codebase change rather than a pure production deployment target change.

missing_requirements.requirement: After rollback, core pages (Home, Daily Verse, Stories, Testament pages) load successfully in an anonymous/signed-out session.
missing_requirements.reason: No test evidence, smoke-check notes, or deployment validation steps are included in the diff to support this acceptance criterion.

hallucinated_features.description: Updated/changed project metadata/state (`project_state.json`) unrelated to performing a production rollback.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly calls for a production rollback only and states no draft/codebase changes; modifying `project_state.json` is not requested as part of REQ-19.
